Meyers February 19, 2016 Four Ads on Top: The Wait Is Over Search Engines | Paid Search Marketing (PPC) In the past 2 weeks, Google AdWords top ad blocks with 4 ads jumped from 1% to 36%, and right-column ads have disappeared entirely (moving to the bottom-left position). Read this post By: Asher Elran February 12, 2016 Unconventional AdWords Takeaways to Boost Your PPC Performance Paid Search Marketing (PPC) There are many different dos and don’ts of Google AdWords all over the Internet. When writing this article, I felt it was safe to call many of the methods I’m going to share, unconventional.In an attempt to resurrect plummeting numbers, and squeeze the last bit of juice from an already producing campaign, I’ve experimented and tested PPC tactics that most users won’t try, eit... Read this post By: David Chapman December 9, 2015 The Ultimate Guide to Finding Opportunities in Adwords Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Online Advertising Looking for ways to optimize your Adwords accounts? This post contains enough tips to keep your busy for months. Read this post By: Larry Kim December 2, 2015 The Ridiculously Smart Guide to Buying Legit Twitter Followers Social Media | Online Advertising | Paid Search Marketing (PPC) Don't give in to the temptation of paying for bogus followers. For the same amount and with a little ingenuity, you could buy real Twitter fans with Followers Campaigns — and get a few other bonuses out of the deal, too! Read this post By: Meghdip Pancholi November 18, 2015 What You Need to Know about Google’s New Online Product Inventory Update Feed Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | E-Commerce SEO | Online Advertising Most of the large ecommerce companies are publishing Google shopping ads using Merchant Center. Because of the heavy rush and frequent purchases, they have to update their feeds and submit to Merchant Center on a real-time basis. Sometimes this makes them inefficient in displaying the latest status of product ads.Google announced an enhancement earlier this year, via the online pr... Read this post By: Kane Jamison November 3, 2015 10 Things I've Learned While Learning Facebook Ads Social Media | Online Advertising | Paid Search Marketing (PPC) Kane Jamison is convinced Facebook Ads are one of the most powerful tools that we currently have as digital marketers, and he's going to share the 10 biggest hurdles that have caught him off guard since he started using Facebook Ads — all in the name of helping you avoid some of the same mistakes. Read this post By: Karen James October 30, 2015 My Story: How Facebook Advertising Performed vs. Google AdWords Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Online Advertising While no advertising platform is guaranteed to yield consistent slam dunks, Facebook Advertising is showing plenty of promise for many brands. Read this post By: Anthony Coraggio October 8, 2015 Campaign Tracking Without Going Crazy: Keeping Order in AdWords Optimization SEO Reporting | SEO Tools | Paid Search Marketing (PPC) Pay-per-click advertising generates vast amounts of data, which presents us with tremendous potential for optimization and success. However, this formidable sword cuts both ways—even skilled managers can quickly find themselves adrift if tests and changes are not carefully tracked. Here’s a quick, actionable guide to keeping order in your AdWords account with a simple and professional activity log. Read this post By: Matt Miller October 2, 2015 Two YouTube PPC Hacks That Will Earn You Praise from Clients Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Online Advertising | Video Though many marketers have taken their eyes off of Youtube, it's still the No. 2 search engine on the web and provides the ideal platform for setting your business apart from the competition via video. Read this post By: Kirk Williams August 20, 2015 How to Know if a Prospect is Ready for PPC Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Online Advertising If your agency provides PPC services, one of the best answers you can add to your repertoire for discussions with prospects is "not yet." Read this post By: Amy Hebdon August 6, 2015 How to Make Paid Search Decisions that Won’t Sabotage Your Success Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Marketing Industry | Online Advertising Whether your a PPC expert or a novice attempting to learn the nuances of the area, taking a smart-from-the-start approach is the best path to success. Read this post By: Anthony Coraggio June 14, 2015 How to Choose a PPC Agency Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Online Advertising | SEO Consulting Many marketers are looking deeper into PPC, but are struggling with how to find the best help. Many end up with agencies that aren't a good fit for their organizations. This post helps make sure you're keeping the right things in mind. Read this post By: Kelsey Libert May 5, 2015 The Reach, Engagement, and ROI of Content Marketing vs. Native Advertising (New Research) Content Marketing | Paid Search Marketing (PPC) Content marketing and native advertising can accomplish similar goals, so which tactic provides the greater ROI, and which is right for your business? This post shows the results of new research from Fractl and Moz, and has the answers you need.
